general.name: Leah Sandacz
general.headline: Fullstack Software Engineer with 8+ years experience
about: Leah is a lifelong programmer with a focus on web applications. Originally self taught before earning a BS in Computer Science, managers have commonly valued her efficiency of output and autonomy in learning new stacks and skills.
In her personal life, she enjoys making web games, watching Anime, running, playing piano, and visiting conventions.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description: Modernized design of Google Search on mobile web browsers. Upgraded components to support dark theme. Implemented dark theme widgets such as the switcher, theme select and promos. Upgraded common UI to reusable components, and built a service for mass tagging and tracking components so they can be componentized.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description: Client-side server infrastructure and build config. Designed the launch that added additional canary stages during deployment, which brought Gmail up to FedRAMP compliance. The launch was used by all other teams. Wrote presubmits, unit tests, and CLI tools that facilitated experiment cleanup, and ensured build safety.

experiences.title: React Developer
experiences.description: Built frontend web applications in React for enterprise clients. Developed an app for searching, viewing and aggregating reports for a learning management system. Involved analyzing requirements, designing an API, building a new application upon an existing codebase, and designing scalable architecture.

experiences.title: Junior Software Developer
experiences.description: Contributed software defect fixes, enhancements, and unit tests in an agile environment for the Unity Client, a desktop client application for OnBase written in C# and WPF. Required modifying and debugging service methods in the application server and considering the impact of the changes to other teams. Wrote NUnit tests for each changeset. Built an administration settings dialog for the Document Tracking module.

education.subject: Computer Science & Engineering
education.description: Computer science degree with additional engineering courses.

volunteering.description: Short description of your role at the event.

projects.name: Tokyo Olympic Games Google Doodle
projects.description: (20% Project) - Built the climbing mini-game in the 2020 Tokyo Summer Olympics Google Doodle promotion. Featured on Google's homepage.
